intro: Impatiens richardsiae, commonly known as the Richards' impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when disturbed. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
